🚀 Propelling India’s DeepTech Ecosystem Forward!

In a proactive step to strengthen India’s innovation landscape, Hon’ble Minister of Commerce & Industry, Shri Piyush Goyal, along with Hon’ble Minister of State for Commerce & Industry and Electronics & IT, Shri Jitin Prasada, chaired a high-impact interaction with over 40 leading DeepTech startups in India.

Held on 15th July 2025 at Vanijya Bhawan, New Delhi, the meeting focused on key challenges and opportunities in the sector, with in-depth discussions around:

💵 Funding accessibility
📚 Regulatory hurdles
📈 Market access

The insights gathered from this dialogue will play a pivotal role in nurturing and accelerating the growth of India’s DeepTech ecosystem. This initiative reaffirms the government’s strong commitment to building a supportive environment for technological innovation and economic progress.

Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade

Shri Piyush Goyal | Shri Jitin Prasada
Shri Amardeep Singh Bhatia | Shri @Smt. Aarti Bhatnagar
Shri Sanjiv | Shri Sumeet Jarangal

#DeepTechIndia #StartupIndia #Innovation #PiyushGoyal #JitinPrasada #TechForBharat #ViksitBharat #FutureOfTech

At the 10th National Startup Advisory Council (NSAC) meeting held today in New Delhi, Secretary, Ministry of Commerce & Industry, Shri Amardeep Singh Bhatia, shared critical insights on the evolving funding landscape for Indian startups.

He emphasized how strategic capital infusion through flagship initiatives like the Startup India Seed Fund Scheme and the newly proposed Fund of Funds is unlocking early-stage innovation and nurturing the next generation of breakthrough technologies.

With focused funding and a vision for long-term growth, the message was clear: India’s startup story is just getting started — and capital will not be a constraint for innovation.

Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade

Shri Piyush Goyal | Shri Jitin Prasada
Shri Amardeep Singh Bhatia | Shri @Smt. Aarti Bhatnagar
Shri Sanjiv | Shri Sumeet Jarangal
 

#StartupIndia #NSAC #SeedFundScheme #DeepTechIndia #StartupFunding #InnovationCapital  #FundOfFunds #IndiaInnovates #ViksitBharat #DeepTechRevolution #EntrepreneurshipIndia

🌟 Strengthening the Backbone of India’s Startup Story!

At the 10th National Startup Advisory Council (NSAC) meeting held today in New Delhi, Hon’ble Minister of State for Commerce & Industry and Electronics & Information & Technology, Shri Jitin Prasada addressed the council with a compelling vision for India’s innovation-led growth.

He lauded the transformative impact India’s startup ecosystem has made across sectors, from digital public infrastructure to grassroots entrepreneurship, and emphasised the need to now shift gears towards greater scale, deeper innovation, and inclusive access.

🔹Stressing on the importance of future-facing sectors like AI, deep-tech and cyber-resilience
🔹 Encouraging more collaborative platforms between government, industry, and academia
🔹Calling for a stronger India-first innovation mindset that solves global problems

The Hon'ble Minister’s address was a powerful call to action, to not just sustain the momentum, but to build an ecosystem that is bold, inclusive, and future-proof.

India’s startup revolution is not just about ideas, it’s about impact at scale.

Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade

Shri Piyush Goyal | Shri Jitin Prasada
Shri Amardeep Singh Bhatia | @Smt. Aarti Bhatnagar  
Shri Sanjiv | Shri Sumeet Jarangal

#StartupIndia #NSAC #InnovationIndia #TechForGood #DigitalEconomy #ViksitBharat #IndiaStartupEcosystem #PublicPrivatePartnership #NextGenStartups #InclusiveInnovation #TechPolicy

🎉 Big congratulations to Dozee, one of IKP-supported startups, on receiving the CE mark for its AI-powered Remote Patient Monitoring (RPM) system! 

This regulatory milestone opens the door to 30+ countries across the European Economic Area, taking Dozee’s Made-in-India innovation to global healthcare markets. With a contactless sensor and AI-powered early warning system, Dozee tracks vitals like heart rate, oxygen saturation, and temperature—empowering proactive, data-driven care.

From securing US FDA 510(k) clearance to impacting 300+ hospitals across India, the US, Middle East, and Africa, Dozee exemplifies how Indian deeptech can drive world-class, scalable healthcare solutions.

Here's to more innovations from India transforming care—one vital sign at a time.

#Dozee #MedTech #HealthTech #RemotePatientMonitoring #CECertified #AIDrivenCare #IndianInnovation #GlobalHealthTech #DeepTech #Startups

Jaypee Institute Of Information Technology (JIIT), Noida, recently hosted a Faculty Development Program (FDP), where Dr. Bindu Nishal was invited as a distinguished speaker to deliver the inaugural address on "One Health: Innovative Solutions for Health, Productivity, and Conservation Challenges."

In her talk, "Introduction to the One Health Approach and the Role of Innovations to Solve Global One Health Challenges," Dr. Nishal emphasised the critical role of innovation in addressing interconnected global issues across human, animal, and environmental health.

She shared insights from IKP's International One Health Incubator, which currently supports four pioneering One Health start-ups. Among them is Capsber Agriscience, a start-up developing biological solutions that originated from a Master's research project—an inspiring example of how academic ideas can lead to real-world impact.

Dr. Nishal encouraged students and researchers to adopt a One Health lens—recognising that solving today’s most urgent challenges requires integrated thinking across human, animal, and environmental health.

IKP remains committed to supporting students, scientists, and innovators who are building solutions for a healthier, more sustainable world.

#OneHealth #OneHealthApproach #InnovationForHealth #GlobalHealth #HealthInnovation #SustainableSolutions #CrossDisciplinary

Dr Jitendra Kumar, Managing Director Biotechnology Industry Research Assistance Council (BIRAC) shared his views on National and Global perspectives on the significance of Deep tech ecosystems and expectations from NCR-Biotech Science Cluster at the #Synchn2025 event organized by Translational Health Science and Technology Institute (THSTI) Faridabad.
He appreciated the efforts of #Industry and #academia in strong R&D engagements with respect to translational research and emerging technologies.
He highlighted the need for clusters such as NCR Biotech Cluster in institutions across the country. He stressed upon encouraging and handholding Spin outs from academia which can be taken up as examples by faculty entrepreneurs and researchers to excel. 
He highlighted the role of BIRAC in strengthening the Biotech ecosystem in the country. Through different funding schemes and mentorship BIRAC has nurtured startups in the domain of Biotech, MedTech, Health tech and Biopharma in developing India specific solutions and important component of Atmanirbhar Bharat. 


Department of Biotechnology
Translational Health Science and Technology Institute (THSTI)
Ganesan Karthikeyan



#Deeptech #ViksitBharat2047 #AtmanirbharBharat #Biotech #MedTech, #Healthtech #Biopharma #Ecosystems

Biotechnology Industry Research Assistance Council (BIRAC) is proud to announce the successful inauguration of MJ Biopharm’s Fill-Finish Facility, supported under the National Biopharma Mission (#NBM)—a transformative step in India’s journey toward end-to-end biomanufacturing excellence.
This facility was inaugurated by Chief Guest Dr. Rajesh Gokhale Secretary DBT, DG BRIC, and Chairman BIRAC. Guest of Honour Dr. Sharmila Bapat Director, NCCS Pune also graced the occasion.
Dr. Rajesh Gokhale congratulated the team on successful establishment of the state-of-the-art ecosystem with the funding support and mentorship of National Biopharma Mission, BIRAC. The facility aligns well with the principles of BioE3 policy promoting biomanufacturing and Atmanirbhar Bharat goal.
Dr Jitendra Kumar MD BIRAC, has extended his warmest congratulations to the MJ Biopharma team and reiterates BIRAC’s firm commitment as a key enabler in the biotech and biopharma sector. He also congratulated the NBM BIRAC team for the impact it has created in the Biopharma domain. Dr. Raj K Shirumalla  Mission Director, NBM, has expressed delight at the success of yet another of the facility supported by NBM.  He emphasised that this infrastructure is expected to accelerate time-to-market for novel biologics by empowering SMEs and startups to scale efficiently and lowers barriers to entry thereby promote innovation-led growth.
NBM has also supported 100L Process Development Lab at MJ Biopharm. Levim Lifetech has also partnered with MJ Biopharma for India’s first biosimilar Liraglutide—another NBM-supported success.
#BIRAC #NBM #BioE3 #DBT #MJBiopharm #BiopharmaInnovation #FillFinish #StartupIndia #MakeInIndia #AtmanirbharBharat #AyushmanBharat #Liraglutide #InsulinInnovation #SkillIndia


Department of Biotechnology  
NITI Aayog 
Office of the Principal Scientific Adviser to the Government of India

As the government envisions a $300B bioeconomy by 2030, India is set to lead the biotech revolution through innovation, startups, sustainability, and the BioE3 policy. #BIRAC is a key catalyst in transforming this vision into reality, positioning India as a global biotech hub.

https://www.linkedin.com/company/c-camp-.text:
We have obtained a patent for a new technology- ‘OptiDrop’ Microfluidic Droplet Flow Cytometer, developed by us in collaboration with Indian Institute of Technology, Madras!

OptiDrop is a benchtop flow-cytometry platform that provides multi-parametric optical analysis at a single cell resolution level —
This involves the world's first non-imaging based, multiplexed, optical analysis for droplet microfluidics applications

This new tech- is affordable and much compact than traditional flow cytometers, and has game-changing downstream applications in #diagnostics, #therapeutics, #agriculture and #animalhealth such as dairy farming.  

Where can OptiDrop be used: 
🧪Detection of fluorescently labelled or non-labelled cells 
🧪Study the downstream impact on individual cells during a drug screen 
🧪Environmental sample analyses (water contamination counter) 
🧪Functional characterization of CAR-T cells in immuno-oncotherapeutics 
🧪 Identification of CRISPR-modified single cells 
🧪 high-efficiency sample prep in single cell genomics

To learn more about this #technology, please reach out to the CCAMP Office of Technology Transfer (#OTT): 📧 ott@ccamp.res.in ☎️ 080 6718 5322

This work is supported by DBT BIRAC Department Of Biotechnology, Government 
.........

Dipankar Deb | Satvasheel Powar | Anil Singh | Gaurav P. | Harish Kanaujia | Salik Sarwar | Manish Singh | Ravinder Kumar | vishal sharma | Minni Kaur | Kushal Deep Jagota | Rewati Lal | Lipsa Rani Panda

#IITMandiCatalyst  #IITMandi #Incubator #Startups #Innovation #StartupInHills #StartupIndia #InnovationEcosystem #Entrepreneurship #Leadership #ArtificialIntelligence #TataSons

IIT Mandi Catalyst, in association with SIDBI, recently conducted a curated session on “Post-Program Support: Providing Resources, Access to Funding, and Ongoing Mentorship” on 8th July 2025 under the Rural Entrepreneurship Development Program (REDP) supported by SIDBI.

Held at the IIT Mandi campus (H.P.), the session aimed to equip participants with the knowledge and tools needed to access resources and navigate the funding landscape after completing the program.

The session opened with a warm welcome from Dr. Dipankar Deb, Director of Incubation, who welcomed the eminent guests along with the amazing participants for the session, setting an inspiring tone for the event.

Mr. T.H.R. Samad, DGM at SIDBI, joined the session virtually and delivered a compelling keynote address. He outlined the vision and objectives of the REDP and assured continued support to the entrepreneurs, emphasizing that joining the SIDBI ecosystem means receiving lifelong guidance—not just limited to the program's duration.

The workshop also featured key insights from financial experts:
✅Sh. Chander Parkash (LDM, Mandi) stressed the importance of CIBIL scores and cautioned participants about hidden banking charges and the serious consequences of delayed repayments.
✅Mr. Vikram (PNB, Kamand Branch) provided valuable perspectives on accessing funding and relevant resources.
✅ Mr. Nishant (SBI, Salgi Branch) shared an overview of financial schemes available for micro-enterprises.

🙏 We extend a special thanks to all the speakers and participants for their active involvement and a shared commitment to fostering growth in our rural entrepreneurial community.

SIDBI(Small Industries Development Bank of India)
Dipankar Deb | Satvasheel Powar | Anil Singh | Gaurav P. | Harish Kanaujia | Salik Sarwar | Manish Singh | Ravinder Kumar | vishal sharma | Minni Kaur | Kushal Deep Jagota | Rewati Lal | Lipsa Rani Panda

#IITMandi #IITMandiCatalyst #RuralEntrepreneurship #REDP #SIDBI #StartupHimachal #EmpoweringCommunities #EntrepreneurshipDevelopment #MandiHimachal #StartupInHills

IIT Mandi Catalyst recently organized an engaging workshop on ‘Branding and Promotion’ for its incubated startups, led by Mr. Russell Longjam (Marketing & Growth Leader, GLOBIZS).

Mr. Russell delivered a powerful session on brand building, promotion, and content marketing, focusing on how early-stage startups can develop their brand, increase visibility, and build trust—even with limited resources.

The session covered key branding strategies, including:
🔹 Consistency in Branding
🔹 Brand Journey Framework
🔹 Core Brand Pillars & Effectiveness Measurement
🔹 Content Creation Strategies for Startups
🔹 Influencer & Community Collaboration
🔹 Storytelling Framework
🔹 Marketing Strategies for VR SaaS, Agro Analytics & Real Estate Tech

📌 Founders walked away with actionable insights to position their ventures more powerfully in today’s competitive landscape.

Dipankar Deb | Satvasheel Powar | Anil Singh | Gaurav P. | Harish Kanaujia | Salik Sarwar | Manish Singh | Ravinder Kumar | vishal sharma | Minni Kaur | Kushal Deep Jagota | Rewati Lal | Lipsa Rani Panda

Last week, founders from across cohorts of Goldman Sachs 10,000 Women tuned into an insightful session on Scaling Brands via Marketplaces with Prathab Anandaraj, Co-Founder of Geek Technology India!

Prathap shared valuable insights on:

➡️ How to choose the right marketplace based on your product category
➡️ The essentials of listing, pricing, and visibility
➡️ Key levers for scaling sustainably in the eCommerce ecosystem
➡️ Real-world tips on navigating challenges and standing out in crowded marketplaces
 
A big thank you to Prathap for the engaging session and to all the Goldman Sachs 10,000 Women alumni who joined us! 🙌

📊 Thank You, Dr. Raghunandan NK! 💡

🙏 We at DERBI Foundation extend our sincere appreciation to Dr. Raghunandan N K for conducting a high-impact workshop on the Business Model Canvas (BMC) for our startup cohort.

🕴 The session offered deep insights into how startups can move beyond traditional business planning to embrace flexible, iterative, and value-driven models. 

🪞 From refining the value proposition and customer segmentation to mapping key metrics, pricing strategies, and leveraging unfair advantages, the workshop equipped our founders with practical tools to build, test, and evolve their models.

Key highlights included:
 ✅ Understanding the BMC framework and its adaptability
 ✅ The Build-Measure-Learn loop in validating startup assumptions
 ✅ Identifying customer pain points and market demand
 ✅ Real-life examples that grounded theory in startup reality

Thank you, Dr. Raghunandan, for empowering our startups with the clarity and structure needed to navigate their growth with confidence and strategy!

Sathyanarayana B V | Bhavani G | Dr. Adithya Hande | Daamini Sharma | MeitY Startup Hub | Pankaj Anand | Startup Karnataka | Karnataka Digital Economy Mission (KDEM) | 

#BusinessModelCanvas #StartupAcceleration #DERBIFoundation #MentorshipMatters #EarlyStageStartups #BuildMeasureLearn #Innovation #Entrepreneurship #StartupSupport #StrategyExecution #ThankYou

As a startup supported by DERBI Foundation, it's inspiring to witness global initiatives like this that are investing in purpose-driven ventures with transformative potential. 

At DERBI Foundation, we’ve experienced firsthand how the right ecosystem support—access to prototyping, mentorship, and patient capital—can shape the journey of early-stage innovators.

Opportunities like these validate the importance of cross-border collaboration in building technologies that don't just push the envelope but also address real-world challenges in health, sustainability, and quality of life.

Kudos to Sound Hub Denmark for amplifying the sound of the future—quite literally! 🔊

As India’s agriculture sector grapples with climate uncertainty, water stress, and rising input costs, the need for resilient, scalable innovations has never been more urgent.  

Krishi Mangal, an initiative by Social Alpha and Cisco CSR, is looking for start-ups working to shape the future of agriculture. 

Now in its third edition, Krishi Mangal invites applications from start-ups developing affordable, scalable, and field-validated technologies that strengthen India’s agricultural resilience.  

The program is open to innovations solving for Integrated Farming Management, Soil Rejuvenation and Irrigation Management, Farm Mechanisation, Post-Harvest Management, and Livestock Waste Management.  

Applications close on 13th July 2025. Apply now: https://lnkd.in/gNwjafu8

Sustain Plus | Manoj Kumar | Ganesh Neelam | Cisco | Harish Krishnan | Rohini Kamath | Tarun Anthony

#FarmingForward #SocialAlpha #CiscoCSR #DeepTechForAgriculture #FarmersDeserveDeepTech

India’s livestock sector is growing—but so is the waste it generates. 

Inadequate waste management leads to methane emissions, groundwater contamination, and health risks for farm-adjacent and farming communities. 
At the same time, this waste stream holds untapped value—from clean energy to soil health to circular inputs for agriculture. 

We’re inviting start-ups using AI/ML and IoT in developing solutions that: 

- Transform livestock waste into biogas, biofertilisers, or organic inputs 
- Build decentralised, efficient processing systems 
- Reduce handling complexity and make adoption feasible for small farmers 
- Enable climate-positive, income-generating uses of dairy or poultry waste 

Solutions should be scalable, sustainable, and relevant to low-resource rural or peri-urban contexts. 

Selected start-ups will receive funding, lab and prototyping support, incubation, expert mentorship, and access to implementation and capital partners. 

Applications close on 13th July 2025. Apply now: https://lnkd.in/gNwjafu8

Sustain Plus | Manoj Kumar | Ganesh Neelam | Cisco | Harish Krishnan | Rohini Kamath | Tarun Anthony

#FarmingForward #LivestockWasteInnovation #CircularEconomy #SocialAlpha #CiscoCSR #DeepTechForAgriculture

Wrapping Up: KVK Baramati's Agri-Innovation Insights!

Our Day 3 in Pune concluded on a high note with a visit to KVK Baramati! We were impressed by the new farming techniques brought in collaboration with international partners and how startups leverage KVK's farmer network for idea validation and reach.

Special thanks to Abhishek Gite, Incubation Manager, for the excellent guided tour.

This inspiring visit officially concludes our memorable Pune adventure, enriching our understanding of the region's vibrant startup landscape.

Rajendra Pawar| Agricultural Development Trust Baramati | Manish Jaiswal | Jaya Tiwari | Amit Singal | Krushik App, KVK, Baramati | Yash Mittal | Rashmi Joshi | Varadh Kulkarni | Soumya Chaugala | Chetan Madivalar 

#PuneEcosystem #KVKBaramati #AgriInnovation #StartupSupport #RuralTech #DeshpandeStartups

Day 3: Exploring Innovation in Baramati at AIC - ADT Baramati Foundation!

Our deep dive into the Pune startup ecosystem continued on Day 3, taking us to Baramati for an insightful visit to the AIC-ADT Baramati Foundation! It was truly inspiring to understand the dynamic ecosystem thriving in a Tier 3 city.

A heartfelt thank you to Abhishek Gite, Incubation Manager; Sonali Saste, Incubation Manager; and Avinash Pudale, Technology Manager, for their valuable time and for sharing their work.

We gained key insights into their success, including:
• A strong on-ground network with KVK Baramati, local industry partners like Baramati Agro Ltd, and their educational institutes.
• A clear sector focus on agri and allied sectors, fostering organic collaborations and expertise.
• International collaborations bringing global resources to the grassroots level.
• A model of smaller cohort sizes for deeper connections and greater impact on startups.

This visit was a powerful testament to the distributed nature of innovation. Our exploration continues!

Rajendra Pawar| Agricultural Development Trust Baramati | Manish Jaiswal | Jaya Tiwari | Amit Singal | Krushik App, KVK, Baramati | Yash Mittal | Rashmi Joshi | Varadh Kulkarni | Soumya Chaugala | Chetan Madivalar 

#PuneStartups #Baramati #AgriTech #RuralInnovation #StartupEcosystem #AICADTBaramati #DeshpandeStartups

https://www.linkedin.com/company/venture.text:
Ready-to-Use Labs, Offices, and Desks and much more at India's largest incubator for science and technology based startups! Come.... 𝗶𝗻𝗰𝘂𝗯𝗮𝘁𝗲 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝘂𝘀!

Venture Center is an award winning, leading incubator for deeptech, knowledge intensive startups, and our 𝗥𝗲𝘀𝗶𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗜𝗻𝗰𝘂𝗯𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗴𝗿𝗮𝗺 for startups offers a range of benefits—without taking any equity!

1. World-Class Infrastructure

Access to state-of-the-art labs, fully equipped offices, and flexible desks. Our facilities are designed to meet the diverse needs of startups, providing everything you need to innovate and grow.

2. Expert Mentorship and Guidance

24/7 access to in-house expertise, in addition to customized one-on-one mentoring from industry veterans. 

3. Funding Opportunities

Access to seed funds, CSR funds, and government grants for different stages of your journey.

4. Prime Location

We are based in Pune, a city known for its thriving tech and innovation scene, and we are in close proximity to prestigious educational institutions and research centers. 

5. Comprehensive Ecosystem

Our extensive support network includes legal assistance, business development resources, regulatory and IP support, and access to workshops and events that provide valuable insights and networking opportunities. 

6. Vibrant peer group community on our campus

Surround yourself with like-minded innovators and entrepreneurs who can inspire and support your startup journey. 

𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗰𝘁 𝘂𝘀 𝘁𝗼𝗱𝗮𝘆! We're looking for startups with an innovative idea or technology in the early stages with a scalable business model!

𝗩𝗶𝘀𝗶𝘁: https://lnkd.in/gNjukCqu
𝗖𝗮𝗹𝗹: +91-9172232211 
𝗘𝗺𝗮𝗶𝗹: managerincubator@venturecenter.co.in

#pune #startup #startupfounder #entrepreneur #zeroequity #incubator

Premnath Venugopalan Manisha Premnath Soma Chattopadhyay Misaal B. Gayathry S Amruta Gore Dr. Mugdha Potnis-Lele Smita Kale Neha Jacob

Were you at our latest Venture Center Library Book Club session? We had a full house diving into The Psychology of Money by Morgan Housel, and the conversations were as electric as the turnout!

We were so fortunate to have Swarang Tanksali lead the session. As a CA with over 10 years of finance experience and a passionate advocate for long-term investing, Swarang brought such wonderful insights to every discussion.

From cognitive biases in the dot-com bubble to the contrasting fates of Jesse Livermore and Bill Gates, we explored how luck, risk, and narrative shape our financial decisions. The crowd resonated most with the discussion on envy, FOMO, and social comparison — especially in the age of social media. Rajat Gupta’s case stirred a lively debate on knowing when ‘enough’ is enough. 

Huge gratitude to Swarang for an enriching evening!

Read More here: https://lnkd.in/gXpEmEx5

Premnath Venugopalan Rohit Joshi Manisha Kharat

July & August at VentureStudio: five chances to up-skill, connect, and create. Whether you’re validating a med-tech device, building an AI product, sharpening your financial model, or simply curious about flavour science, the next six weeks are packed with hands-on learning and networking at Ahmedabad University.

1️⃣ Launch Without Liability: Legal Readiness for MedTech Startups
Date / Time: 18 July 2025 | 4:00 - 5:00 PM IST
Format / Venue: Live webinar (Zoom)
Speaker: Namita Malhotra, Founder - Radiyes Consultants
Why attend: Spot IP, supplier-contract, and regulatory pitfalls before they derail your product launch and learn practical safeguards for each stage of development.
Registration: https://lnkd.in/gVFtKRxB

2️⃣ Financial Modelling & Valuation for Startups
Date / Time: 22 July 2025 | 6:00 - 8:00 PM IST
Format / Venue: Live webinar (Zoom)
Speaker: CA Arpit Parikh, Director - Professional Multi Financial Services Ltd.
Why attend: Decode revenue drivers, DCF/VC valuation methods, and cash-flow projections in an interactive Excel walkthrough, no advanced finance background required.
Registration: https://lnkd.in/g6uKqT2A

3️⃣ AI Demo Night: Live Startup Demos & Q&A with eChai Ventures
Date / Time: 25 July 2025 | 6:00 - 8:00 PM IST
Format / Venue: Room 107, University Centre, Central Campus (in-person)
What to expect: Ten early-stage founders show working AI prototypes, followed by rapid-fire feedback and open networking with peers, mentors, and investors.
Registration (attendees): https://lnkd.in/gN25HhGE
Apply to demo (startups): https://lnkd.in/gbgrXfb8

4️⃣ Intro to Gen AI: From Theory to Agentic Workflows
Date / Time: 2 August 2025 | 10:00 AM - 4:00 PM IST
Format / Venue: Hands-on workshop, VentureStudio, North Campus
Facilitator: Jash Rathod, Head of Operations & Technology, JGS Tex Fab
Why attend: Build prompt engineering skills and no-code AI agents you can deploy immediately, perfect for founders, students, and professionals new to Gen AI. Lunch included.
Registration: https://lnkd.in/g62nhqUb

5️⃣ Flavours & Futures: A Hands-On Gastronomy Workshop
Date / Time: 9 August 2025 | 5:00 - 6:30 PM IST
Format / Venue: Cafeteria, Central Campus (on-campus)
Chef-Mentor: Chef Rahul Bhale
Why attend: Cook side-by-side with our culinary team, experiment with new flavour profiles, and explore the future of sustainable food, aprons provided!
Registration: https://lnkd.in/gQyxvsRK

#VentureStudio #AhmedabadUniversity #StartupEvents #MedTech #AI #Finance #GenAI #Innovation

Made in Ahmedabad, for India 🇮🇳! Two local startups empowered at VentureStudio, Ahmedabad University, are redefining India’s drone capabilities — right from the heart of our DST Prayas Shala fabrication lab.

🔧 Alphoenix Design Pvt.Ltd.  is developing indigenous BLDC motors for drones, pushing the boundaries of hardware innovation.

🤝 Vayunotics is collaborating with Alphoenix to integrate these motors into a cutting-edge, indigenous, autonomous system and deploying it on autopilot.

Together, they’re building India’s next-gen drone ecosystem, entirely designed, developed, and tested in Ahmedabad.

This is the power of collaborative innovation in action, and just one of many success stories powered by our robust prototyping infrastructure and startup-centric ecosystem at VentureStudio.

Learn more about Alphoenix alphoenixdesign.com

Learn more about Vayunotics vayunotics.com

#DeepTech #Drones #StartupIndia #AhmedabadUniversity #Innovation #AutonomousSystems #VentureStudio #AtmanirbharBharat

It’s easy to fall in love with your technology. The real magic happens when you fall in love with solving the right problem.
At ProtoQuik Launchpad, founders are encouraged to challenge their assumptions, test quickly, fail smart, and focus on solving what truly matters. Because building for the real world starts with understanding the world’s real needs.

#ProtoQuikLaunchpad #ProductThinking #TechForImpact #HardwareStartups #VoicesOfWisdom #iCreateWithYou #robotics

(h.c.) | Siddharth Pareek | Prasen Vinchurkar | Hiiren Y. | Dr. Raashid Saiyed | Dr. Sanjeev K Yadav | Anish Chavda | Dr Guru | ARTPARK | IHFC (TIH of IIT Delhi) | EECS IISc | IoT & Robotics Lab | E&TC Department, JEC | e-Yantra, IIT Bombay | AICRA - All India Council for Robotics & Automation | COEP Technological University | Parul University | Nirma University | Startup India | Kaushalya The Skill University | Indian Institute of Technology, Madras | Manoj Bhataria | AVINASH PANCHAL | Noa Muzzafi नेहा 诺亚 | Nehaa Sharma | TiE Ahmedabad | Yogesh Kathrecha | Parimal Verma

Accelerating Robotics & UAV Innovation with MATLAB & Simulink

As part of the #ProtoQuik Launchpad Cohort 1, an insightful session was conducted by Dr. Richa Singh, Application Engineer at MathWorks, along with Mr. Kapil Koul, Lead – Startup Accelerator Program at MathWorks.

The session introduced the cohort to how model-based design can streamline the development of autonomous systems using MATLAB and Simulink—covering system-level simulation, motion planning, AI integration, and embedded deployment.

The session also highlighted the MathWorks Startup Accelerator Program, which supports early-stage ventures with tools, mentorship, and resources to move from idea to implementation efficiently.
Riya Singha Singh, Associate – Programs & Initiatives at iCreate, coordinated the session as part of the cohort’s technical learning track, ensuring a valuable knowledge exchange between the innovators and industry experts.

Not every great idea survives the leap from whiteboard to world.
Robotics and hardware startups often falter, not for lack of tech, but because their business models aren't built for the real world.
That’s where ProtoQuik Launchpad steps in. In just 30 days, founders move from theory to traction—testing fast, adapting faster, and building for what actually works.
Because real ventures aren’t built in pitch decks. They’re forged in reality with the right mentorship and opportunities.
